alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Hardeman (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 18 at 5:51AM CDT until June 18 at 6:15AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Union County in northeastern Mississippi... Marshall County in northwestern Mississippi... Western Tippah County in northeastern Mississippi... Benton County in northeastern Mississippi... Southeastern Fayette County in west Tennessee... Southwestern Hardeman County in west Tennessee... * Until 615 AM CDT. * At 550 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Slayden, or 7 miles north of Holly Springs, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Holly Springs, Ripley, Wall Doxey State Park, Lamar, Blue Mountain, Snow Lake Shores, Canaan, Mt Pleasant, Bethlehem, Gravestown, Michigan City, Red Banks, Slayden, Walnut, Hickory Flat, Ashland, Potts Camp, Falkner, Myrtle and Malone. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
